konfound 0.4.0

Draw figures for change in effect size as a function of switching or replacing outcomes

Source: R/tkonfound_fig.R
tkonfound_fig.Rd

This function returns two plots for change in effect size as a function of switching or replacing outcomes, one for all possibilities (switching), another zoomed in the area for positive RIR

tkonfound_fig(
  a,
  b,
  c,
  d,
  thr_p = 0.05,
  switch_trm = TRUE,
  test = "fisher",
  replace = "control"
)

Arguments

a

cell is the number of cases in the control group showing unsuccessful results

b

cell is the number of cases in the control group showing successful results

c

cell is the number of cases in the treatment group showing unsuccessful results

d

cell is the number of cases in the treatment group showing successful results

thr_p

the p-value threshold used to evaluate statistical significance, with the default of 0.05

switch_trm

whether switching the two cells in the treatment row or the two cells in the control row, with the default of the treatment row

test

whether using Fisher's Exact Test (default) or chi-square test

replace

whether using entire sample or the control group to calculate the base rate, with the default of the control group

Value

prints 2 figures for how number of hypothetical cases switched changes the effect size

Examples

# using tkonfound_fig for a study where 2 by 2 table is (35, 17, 17, 38)
tkonfound_fig(35, 17, 17, 38)
#> [[1]]
#> Warning: Removed 103 rows containing missing values (`geom_label_repel()`).

#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "A bend in line indicates switches from the control row because the treatment row was exhausted."
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> Warning: Removed 18 rows containing missing values (`geom_label_repel()`).

#> 
tkonfound_fig(35, 17, 17, 38, thr_p = 0.01)
#> [[1]]
#> Warning: Removed 103 rows containing missing values (`geom_label_repel()`).

#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "A bend in line indicates switches from the control row because the treatment row was exhausted."
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> Warning: Removed 21 rows containing missing values (`geom_label_repel()`).

#> 
tkonfound_fig(35, 17, 17, 38, thr_p = 0.01, switch_trm = FALSE)
#> [[1]]
#> Warning: Removed 103 rows containing missing values (`geom_label_repel()`).

#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "A bend in line indicates switches from the treatment row because the control row was exhausted."
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> Warning: Removed 7 rows containing missing values (`geom_label_repel()`).

#> 
tkonfound_fig(35, 17, 17, 38, thr_p = 0.01, switch_trm = TRUE, test = "chisq")
#> [[1]]
#> Warning: Removed 103 rows containing missing values (`geom_label_repel()`).

#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "A bend in line indicates switches from the control row because the treatment row was exhausted."
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> Warning: Removed 20 rows containing missing values (`geom_label_repel()`).

#> 
tkonfound_fig(35, 17, 17, 38, thr_p = 0.01, switch_trm = TRUE, test = "chisq", replace = "entire")
#> [[1]]
#> Warning: Removed 103 rows containing missing values (`geom_label_repel()`).

#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "A bend in line indicates switches from the control row because the treatment row was exhausted."
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> Warning: Removed 13 rows containing missing values (`geom_label_repel()`).

#>
